intro: Styphelia empetrifolia, commonly known as the rock heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and evergreen, contributing to its hardy nature. Styphelia empetrifolia is well adapted to coastal and inland dune environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
